title: Is nail polish a pure substance? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on your definition of a pure substance: My definition of a pure substance is: a quantity of an element like iron FE or silica SI. That is a pure substance. Nail polish is the equivalent to an automobile paint: it is made up of petrochemical lacquer, pigments, volatile agents which evaporate and set the lacquer. In fact not so long ago hot rodders and others who wanted beautiful colours for their cars would buy gallons of nail polish to spray paint their cars. Some people still do. Can't find any links to images though after quick Google search.
